skill.name: cirq
skill.description: Quantum computing framework for building, simulating, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Use this skill when working with quantum algorithms, quantum circuit design, quantum simulation (noiseless or noisy), running on quantum hardware (Google, IonQ, AQT, Pasqal), circuit optimization and compilation, noise modeling and characterization, or quantum experiments and benchmarking (VQE, QAOA, QPE, randomized benchmarking).
skill.summary: Quantum computing framework for building, simulating, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Us...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All content describes how to use the external Cirq Python library. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Quantum computing requires specialized knowledge of circuit design, gates, and simulation. This skill provides comprehensive documentation for building, simulating, and running quantum circuits with Cirq. Get code examples, best practices, and reference guides for quantum algorithms and hardware integration.
actual_capabilities: Build quantum circuits with gates, qubits, and measurements
Simulate circuits with state vector and density matrix methods
Optimize and compile circuits for quantum hardware
Model noise and run noisy simulations
Execute on Google Quantum AI, IonQ, Azure, AQT, and Pasqal
Implement quantum algorithms: VQE, QAOA, QPE, and benchmarking
limitations: Requires Cirq library installation (uv pip install cirq)
Simulation limited by classical compute (typically 25-30 qubits)
Hardware access requires separate provider accounts and credentials

use_cases.title: Algorithm research
use_cases.description: Design and test quantum algorithms like VQE for chemistry and QAOA for optimization problems.

use_cases.title: Learn quantum computing
use_cases.description: Understand quantum circuits, gates, and simulation through hands-on examples and exercises.

use_cases.title: Hardware deployment
use_cases.description: Compile and run circuits on real quantum computers from multiple cloud providers.

prompt_templates.title: Basic circuit
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a Bell state circuit in Cirq with Hadamard and CNOT gates.

prompt_templates.title: Simulation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I add depolarizing noise to a circuit and simulate it with the density matrix simulator?

prompt_templates.title: Hardware
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I compile a circuit for Google Sycamore hardware and submit it for execution?

prompt_templates.title: Algorithm
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me a complete QAOA implementation in Cirq for solving MaxCut on a graph.

output_examples.input: Create a quantum circuit that creates a Bell state and measures it
output: â€¢ Create two LineQubit objects using cirq.LineQubit.range(2)
â€¢ Build circuit: H on qubit 0, CNOT(qubit 0, qubit 1), measure both with key 'result'
â€¢ Simulate with cirq.Simulator() running 1000 repetitions
â€¢ Get histogram of results showing |00âŸ© and |11âŸ© each appearing ~50% of the time

best_practices: Start with simulator validation before running on expensive hardware
Use parameterized circuits and sweeps for optimization tasks
Characterize noise with calibration data before mitigation
Optimize circuits with built-in transformers before hardware submission
anti_patterns: Running unvalidated circuits directly on quantum hardware
Using oversimplified noise models that do not match device calibration
Skipping measurement key labels leads to confusion in results
Ignoring circuit depth limits causes coherence errors

faq.question: What quantum processors does Cirq support?
faq.answer: Google Quantum AI (Sycamore, Weber), IonQ (trapped ion), Azure Quantum (IonQ, Honeywell), AQT, and Pasqal (neutral atom).

faq.question: How many qubits can I simulate?
faq.answer: State vector simulation works up to 25-30 qubits on typical hardware. Density matrix for noisy simulation is limited to fewer qubits.

faq.question: How do I connect to quantum hardware?
faq.answer: Install provider packages (cirq-google, cirq-ionq, etc.), set API credentials as environment variables, and use the service API to submit jobs.

faq.question: Is my data safe on quantum cloud services?
faq.answer: Cirq only sends circuit definitions to providers. Your code and results are subject to provider privacy policies. Review each provider's terms.

faq.question: Why does my circuit fail validation?
faq.answer: Common issues: qubits not connected in device topology, gates not in native gateset, circuit depth exceeds coherence time. Use device metadata and transformers to fix.

faq.question: How does Cirq compare to Qiskit?
faq.answer: Cirq focuses on circuit-level design with Google Quantum AI integration. Qiskit offers more backends and higher-level algorithms. Both are production-ready.
